_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The process of cutting down a great tree: Cut the tree down at the roots
Dig them up and pull them out, down to the fibers and stems
Cut up the parts and chop it into splinters
Dry the splinters in the wind and sun
Winnow the ashes in a strong wind or float them away down a swift stream
The process of the cessation of sufferin: Concentrate on the drawbacks of things that are prone to being grasped
The entire mass of suffering ceases
